item.title: Silent Hill f: Shrine Maiden Sakuko-Like Entity Boss Guide (Sound of Silence Trophy)
item.description:
Silent Hill f brings back nightmarish monstrosities as bosses for players to go head-to-head against using the newly revamped combat system. One of the first major bosses you'll be facing is a demonic Sakuko-like entity disguised as a Shrine Maiden. Players will need to beat this boss towards the end of the Corridors chapter, and will need to avoid getting hit by its Suzu Bell attack to unlock the Sound of Silence trophy in Silent Hill f .

All Shrine Maiden Sakuko-Like Entity Attacks in Silent Hill f

Shrine Maiden Sakuko-Like Entity is the first major boss players will encounter in Silent Hill f . Sakuko uses a spiked mace with varying attacks that punish players for being either too far or too close to her. So, you'll need to dynamically switch your positioning from close-quarters or mid-range combat during the fight to avoid Sakuko's variety of attacks.

Let's check out all Sakuko boss attacks and how they can counter these in Silent Hill f .

Attack Image

Move Name

Attack Pattern

How to Dodge/Counter

Mace Ground Smash

Sakuko will spread her arms, jump close to players, lift her spiked mace over her head, and smash it on the ground.

The priority should be to counter this attack by attacking Sakuko when she's about to smash the mace into the ground. However, if you don't have enough Sanity, then simply dodge away.

Chain Throw

The boss will lift her mace in the air and throw it swiftly at the players. This can be followed up with either a second throw or an AOE chain pull that can deal additional damage.

Players must focus on when Sakuko lifts the mace into the air, and dodge towards her when she finally throws it. Pulling off a perfect dodge will give you ample opportunity to land a few attacks.

Mace and Chain Combo

If players are too close to Sakuko for a prolonged time, she'll launch a melee combo using the mace and chain.

It's best to keep your distance from Sakuko after landing in a few hits to avoid triggering this attack. If the attack is underway, simply perform two dodges away from Sakuko and keep walking back to avoid getting hit.

Death Hug

During the later stages of the Sakuko-like entity boss fight in Silent Hill f , her body will slouch down slightly and launch towards the players to lock them in a grab/hug. Getting caught in this attack can drain your HP anywhere from 25% to 50%.

Make sure to keep an eye on Sakuko's body posture, especially during the later phase of the fight. If she slouches her body down or says "Dodge This," quickly dodge away, or try to time a perfect dodge.

Suzu Bell Attack

Once her HP falls below ~50%, Sakuko will launch a full-scale Suzu Bell attack, which will enshroud the area in thick crescent fog. Sakuko will teleport away from players and charge up the attack three times. Getting hit by the Suzu Bell attack will prevent players from unlocking the Sound of Silence trophy in Silent Hill f .

Once the boss begins her Suzu Bell attack, you'll need to rely on audio or spot her glowing halo through the fog to pinpoint her location. Once you've found her, quickly run towards her and hit her with either one heavy attack or two light attacks to interrupt.

Best Strategy to Beat Sakuko-Like Entity in Silent Hill f (Sound of Silence Trophy)

This video showcases the strategy to beat Sakuko and avoid all her attacks, including the process of unlocking the Sound of Silence trophy in Silent Hill f .

Right after you reach the end of the Corridors chapter, the objective will change to "Find the Fox Mask" in Silent Hill f . There's a shrine right before the Shrine Maiden Sakuko-like Entity boss fight that you should use to create a save point. This will be extremely helpful for you to reload, in case you get hit by her Suzu Bell attack and lose the chance of unlocking the Sound of Silence trophy.

The Beetle Omamori works great against Sakuko, as it'll let you inflict increased damage when the boss is stunned.

Make sure to use the Naginata weapon for this boss fight. Once the boss fight starts, wait for Sakuko to trigger her Chain Throw attack, which you should avoid using perfect dodge. Make sure to dodge in the boss's direction to quickly follow up with at least two heavy attacks .

You should also fill up your Sanity meter to use focus attack counters against Sakuko. One attack that lets you counter Sakuko is the Mace Ground Smash. When Sakuko lifts her spiked mace above her head, you'll see the prompt to counter, and you should press the attack button quickly to interrupt her. This can be followed by two more heavy attacks before backing out.

Once Sakuko initiates her Suzu Bell attack, you should quickly be on alert and detect her teleport location within the boss arena. Once you spot her glowing halo ring through the fog, quickly rush towards her and land a heavy or two light attacks. You'll need to repeat this to interrupt her Suzu Bell attack three times each time. Sakuko can also initiate a small-scale Suzu Bell attack, with a shorter charge duration, mid-fight, so watch out for that too.

9.3 /10
10 /10

Silent Hill f

item.title: Monopoly GO: Lucky Coin Minigame, Explained
item.description:
Monopoly GO keeps players hooked with a bunch of exciting mini-games such as Tycoon Racers, Peg-Es Prize Drop, and Carnival Games. Joining the lineup is a brand-new minigame, called Lucky Coin. Unlike other mini-games that focus on collecting tokens or racing to the finish, Lucky Coin is all about chance and streaks.

In this minigame, players can flip virtual coins and unlock prizes that grow more valuable with every successful streak. This mix of luck, suspense, and escalating rewards sets Lucky Coin apart, making it one of the most exciting additions to the game yet. If youre a dedicated Monopoly GO player, youll definitely want to know how the Lucky Coin minigame works, what rewards to expect, and how to make the most of it.

How To Play Monopoly GO Lucky Coin

The Lucky Coin minigame activates whenever you land on a special Lucky Coin tile while rolling your dice. Once triggered, youll flip a coin by tapping the screen, with each flip landing on either heads or tails. Scoring at least one head guarantees an instant reward, but the real fun begins when you start chaining streaks of consecutive heads. The longer your streak, the bigger the prize.

Two or three heads in a row escalate your prizes significantly, while longer streaks have the potential to unlock jackpot-level rewards. Multipliers also play a big role here. Rolling at higher multipliers like x5 or x10 can boost the value of your winnings even further. However, flip limits may apply per session, which means timing and streak management become just as important as luck.

As always, the final details may change once Monopoly GO Lucky Coin officially rolls out to all players.

Monopoly GO Lucky Coin Rewards

While official details are still under wraps, heres a list of possible prizes you can win from Monopoly GO s Lucky Coin minigame. Remember, the higher your streaks, the more rewards you can win.

  • Extra Dice Rolls
  • Sticker Packs
  • Cash
  • Flash Event bonuses

When Is Monopoly GO Lucky Coin Releasing?

The Lucky Coin minigame in Monopoly GO doesnt have an official release date just yet. While players are eagerly waiting for its release, Scopely has not confirmed exactly when it will go live. Like other special features and events, its expected to roll out gradually, starting from a few selected regions. This way, the developers can gather feedback and fine-tune the game before its release. Until then, fans will need to keep an eye on official announcements and community updates to try out this exciting new minigame.

1741
8.8 /10

Monopoly Go!

item.title: Games Where You Ignore The Story And (Still) Win
item.description:
Video game stories can often deepen immersion or serve as a source of direction for the player to follow, but sometimes they are optional luxuries rather than necessities. Certain games offer extensive lore and narrative layers, yet their core loop stands entirely on its own, where the fighting and exploration are rewarded far more than attention to dialogue and cutscenes.

Whether its through relentless combat, punishing bosses, loot-driven systems, or perfectly optimized speed runs, plenty of games prove that a well-designed gameplay loop can carry itself. For those who value performance over plot, these worlds demonstrate that success does not require players to focus solely on the story, but can instead come from their personal desires and playstyles.

Monster Hunter Wilds

The Hunt Is The Story

Monster Hunter Wilds
58
8.2 /10
Released
February 28, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Blood, Crude Humor
Developer(s)
Capcom
Powered by

Monster Hunter has always placed narrative as secondary to its mechanical loop, and Wilds continues this tradition. Each encounter is defined by the player's ability to learn monster behaviors, prepare properly, and adapt under pressure. The framework of an ongoing story sets the stage, but the real measure of progress is how well-crafted gear and strategy hold up against increasingly ferocious creatures.

Victory comes from repetition, patience, and precise execution. The deeper one delves into crafting weapons, fine-tuning armor sets, and experimenting with hunting tactics, the less the overarching narrative matters. Ultimately, success is forged during the hunts themselves.

Hades

Mythology That Takes A Backseat To Mechanics

Hades
10 /10
16
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Hades delivers a rich mythological narrative, but its roguelike core ensures that progression can unfold even when the story is ignored. Each escape attempt is a test of combat mastery, a knowledge of synergy between boons, and a familiarity with the ever-changing chambers of the Underworld.

The plot adds depth, yet victory is determined solely by gameplay. Clearing runs comes not from dialogue with gods or extended cutscenes, but from the refinement of builds and the consistent improvement of skill over the course of 100s of runs.

Elden Ring

Victory Carved Through Skill

Elden Ring
10 /10
70
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Elden Rings narrative and lore stretch deep into cryptic mythmaking, but the true triumph lies in perseverance and mechanical mastery. The Lands Between are filled with challenging encounters, and success is dictated by preparation, adaptability, and combat execution. The notoriously tough bosses demand patience and sharp reflexes, not narrative understanding.

Weapons, builds, and exploration define the player's progression more than any spoken line of dialogue, and the path to victory lies in learning attack patterns and discovering new strategies to survive overwhelming odds. While lore enriches the world, it remains secondary to the combat and riveting gameplay.

Doom: The Dark Ages

Violence Is The Only Way Forward

DOOM: The Dark Ages
8 /10
26
9.0 /10
Released
May 15, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence
Powered by

The Doom series has never required a narrative to justify its relentless pace, and The Dark Ages continues that trend. Combat is a test of precision shooting, aggressive movement, and resource management. Although the story is definitely more in the player's face in this entry, the shooting will always remain king.

Players end up sprinting, diving, flying, and charging across landscapes at insane speeds. It's nice to have a stronger narrative thread holding things together, but with so much satisfaction coming from the gameplay itself, players should feel no need to pay much attention to the narrative at any point.

Borderlands 4

Shoot First, Listen Second

Borderlands 4
8 /10
22
7.9 /10
Released
September 12, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Powered by

Borderlands 4 takes everything that makes the franchise so iconic and dials it to eleven. More weapons, more enemies, and more explosions than ever, all across a gigantic open-world full of surprises around every corner. While there is a story to follow to keep players invested in the adventure, the real draw is the side content and extra loot that players can grab outside the campaign.

If the main story takes around 15 hours to beat, then the side quests easily triple that. It's easy to get lost in the world, and by the time players come back to finish off those last few missions, they should be stacked in terms of loadouts and skills, ready to take on that final threat.

Salt And Sanctuary

A Cryptic Narrative Overshadowed By Darkness

Salt and Sanctuary
9 /10
Released
March 15, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

Salt and Sanctuary offers a mysterious narrative heavily steeped in atmosphere, but players have no obligation to pay attention to it. Instead, they can find success by mastering movement, memorizing attack patterns, and progressing through the dark depths below.

The world is structured in an interconnected manner that allows players to loop back on themselves and return to previous locations to finish off any missed bosses or quests. Having a narrative in the background ties the world together, yet by ignoring it, players can still enjoy the environments and enemies for what they are.

Neon White

Speeding Past The Dialogue

Neon White
10 /10
Released
June 16, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco
Powered by

Neon White pairs story-driven dialogue with its stylish speedrunning design, but thanks to the satisfying gameplay loop and unique visuals, the story often comes second to the actual game. Each level is a puzzle of optimization, rewarding experimentation and creativity, while the dialogue serves more as a supplement to keep things moving forward.

Mastery lies in stringing together weapon abilities, maintaining momentum, and refining runs for efficiency. The satisfaction of shaving seconds off of completion times exists independently from the story, proving that a great game can be enjoyed even without paying attention to the story.

Resident Evil 6

Best Not To Think Too Hard

Resident Evil 6
6 /10
6.4 /10
Released
October 2, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Resident Evil 6 is, for many people, the end of an era for the Resident Evil franchise. The series had fully shifted away from horror and into action, leaning heavily into absurdity and explosive set-pieces to deliver a game that is narratively flawed but still a boatload of fun.

It can be hard to try to piece everything together, with so many characters and so much going on, so it is fine to just focus on shooting and appreciating the amusing dialogue and silly character interactions. No section in the game will prevent further progression if players forget a narrative detail, as things are constantly in motion regardless of whether the story is focused on or not.

item.title: World of Warcraft's Alliance vs. Horde Midnight Controversy May Already Have a Happy Ending
item.description:
World of Warcraft is on its way to the release of the 11.2.5 patch, which determines the halfway point from the launch of season 3 of The War Within and the eventual release of the Midnight expansion. The patch will launch on October 7 and include WoW 's Legion Remix event, which is highly anticipated by fans due to the sheer amount of free cosmetics one can farm, including unique mounts, as well as the fact that Remix events typically make the player character OP and capable of soloing most content in the game. Still, while Midnight is the next big thing, it was marred by controversies from the get-go, even though it may finally be healing from one of its worst.

Players lamented several issues with World of Warcraft 's Midnight expansion, mostly tied to its reveal in August. These are:

  • A cinematic that doesn't really "sell" the expansion and features plastic-y character models, as opposed to TWW's.
  • A big focus on housing, which makes it seem like a core part of the expansion, rather than actual story progress or relevant new content.
  • The return of World of Warcraft 's Haranir as a playable race, which seems disconnected from The War Within and Midnight itself, now.
  • The addition of a new Demon Hunter playable race for the Alliance's Void Elves, but no new playable race for the Horde side.
  • The fact that Silvermoon City was presented as the new expansion hub, with a "small" section dedicated to Alliance players, who would be killed on sight everywhere else.

The biggest issues are the latter two, as a new playable race for Demon Hunters dedicated to only one faction is dividing World of Warcraft 's playerbase, and the fact that the expansion's main hub is mainly for one faction for the entire expansion can feel like an unnecessary punishment that takes the game back years. However, fans may be getting their deserved happy ending soon with both of these pressing problems.

October 1 is Going to Be a Big Day For World of Warcraft Fans

Blizzard has already confirmed a Midnight deep dive from the developers for October 1, so fans can expect more news regarding the expansion and its contents. This may not be the resolution that the newly sparked WoW Alliance vs. Horde debate needs, depending on what is shown, but it may at least clarify things regarding the approach to Silvermoon City as a hub for both factions.

How World of Warcraft's Alliance and Horde Can Explore The Main Midnight Hub

Originally, Blizzard devs described the remade Silvermoon City in Midnight as a Horde hub with a little space reserved for Alliance characters, which would otherwise be killed on sight elsewhere in the city. The kill-on-sight part may still apply, but the original statement has since been de-escalated by the official website's Midnight info round-up, which instead refers to the city as fully explorable by Horde characters and explorable up to two-thirds by Alliance ones.

World of Warcraft's Demon Hunter Controversy Explained

The second faction-specific issue comes from Demon Hunters, which have historically been only available for Night Elves and Blood Elves, so one race per faction. With Midnight's new Demon Hunter spec in WoW , though, Blizzard is adding the option for players to unlock Void Elves as a playable race for the class. This is thematic given the fact that the new Devourer spec is entirely Void-based, and Blizzard has also stated that it currently makes sense for Void Elves to become Demon Hunters because they are in a place where they are willing to sacrifice everything.

Why There is Hope For Nightborne Demon Hunters in World of Warcraft

This is problematic for Horde players, though, as it means skewing the race selection for Demon Hunters two versus one in favor of the Alliance. The most immediate step to remedy this would be to add another playable DH race, this time for the Horde, and World of Warcraft 's Nightborne perfectly fit the bill. They may not be perfect story-wise, but recent datamining reveals that Nightborne can indeed perform Demon Hunter animations. The caveat is that they are technically using the same model skeleton as Night Elves, so the reason that this is happening now and never in the past may be due to some update, but it's still a step in the right direction.

How World of Warcraft May Address Its Alliance vs. Horde Problem in Midnight

If Silvermoon City has Horde-only areas that don't truly preclude players from exploring as they please, the controversy may sort itself out especially seeing how having city guards kill Alliance players on sight would also be immersion-breaking given the expansion's context. Likewise, if Nightborne now becoming able to perform Demon Hunter actions is not a mistake, it means that Blizzard is indeed planning to make them playable for the class in the future, which could happen as early as within Midnight itself, rather than in World of Warcraft 's The Last Titan or beyond.

This remains speculation for the time being, but it is extremely unlikely that Blizzard will make World of Warcraft 's Silvermoon City the main hub for the entire expansion, only for it to be mostly inaccessible to and unplayable for Alliance players. Demon Hunters may be on a different level, though, and it's also possible that if the Nightborne don't gain access to the class, the Horde will get a similar treatment for a different race and class combination further down the line, as hinted by Blizzard devs at the Gamescom reveal.

World of Warcraft: Midnight

item.title: Best Strategy Games For Scenario Editors
item.description:
When it comes to strategy games, theres a certain type of player whos never content to merely conquer what the developers set before them. For the creative strategist inside every fan of the genre, the scenario editor is sort of like the main course.

Whether it's because fans want to replicate the achievements of their favorite generals from history or conjure up devious meatgrinders so that their friends can inevitably fail, the following strategy games possess some of the best scenario/campaign editors on the market. Each of these titles gives players plenty of tools to invoke their inner Alexander.

StarCraft 2

A Toolkit That Features Arcade Publishing

StarCraft 2
8 /10
9.2 /10
Released
July 27, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Blizzard has always understood that the real fun begins when players are let loose with the tools. StarCraft 2 s editor is legendary, to the point where its spawned entire sub-genres. The Galaxy Editor for StarCraft 2 is a behemoth, offering scripting, triggers, cinematic tools, and nearly limitless customization of units and mechanics.

Beginners might find it intimidating at first, but the wealth of tutorials and robust community support smooths out the learning curve. The best part is that if players put in the effort, they can create a fully-functioning new game mode, complete with custom UI, win conditions, and narrative arcs. For fans who want to do more than move marines and zerglings around a map, StarCraft 2 s editor is essentially a game development bootcamp in disguise.

Panzer Corps 2

Granular Control & Fun What-Ifs

Panzer Corps 2
Strategy
Systems
Released
March 19, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Wargame aficionados know that Panzer Corps 2 is a spiritual successor to Panzer General . Nevertheless, its scenario editor represents the creative playground grognards. The in-game editor lets fans sculpt every aspect of a battle: map layout, unit placement, weather, victory conditions, and intricate event scripting. Panzer Corps 2 s editor is built for both historical accuracy and wild what-ifs. Want to see what happens if Italy invades Norway in 1939? Players are welcome to try!

Theres a thriving modding community constantly churning out alternate history campaigns and ultra-difficult challenges, many of which are very well balanced and difficult. The UI is refreshingly modern, making it easy to whip up a custom scenario without a 300-page manual. In short, Panzer Corps 2 s editor is the best sandbox this side of the Eastern Front.

Warcraft 3: Reforged

A Fantasy Lover's Dream

Warcraft 3: Reforged
Strategy
Systems
9.0 /10
Released
January 28, 2020
ESRB
t

Powered by

Despite its controversial launch, Warcraft 3: Reforged maintains the old magic when it comes to scenario editing. The World Editor is the star of the show, responsible for spawning mods that became full-blown phenomena (like Defense of the Ancients). Warcraft 3 s editor features intuitive scripting with triggers and the ability to customize everything from unit abilities to weather effects. It's simple enough for beginners to bang out a decent map in an afternoon, yet deep enough for obsessive creators to spend months crafting a new campaign or custom game mode.

The visual upgrade means that maps look better than ever, and Blizzards continued support has kept the editor alive (like the 1.35 patch, which reintroduced custom campaigns), even as the base games reputation took a few hits. If fans ever wanted to remake their favorite Lord of the Rings battle, set up an elaborate RPG with dialogue trees and quests, or see what happens when 100 Tauren are pitted against 1,000 Footmen, this is the editor for them.

Age Of Mythology (Extended Edition/Retold)

Freedom Mixed With The Divine

Age of Mythology: Retold
8 /10
6.0 /10
Released
September 4, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Violence
Powered by

Age of Mythology s editor is a lesser-sung hero compared to its Age of Empires sibling, although its arguably more versatile. The editors event triggers and cinematic tools allow players to craft wild mythological adventures with scripted gods, monsters, and environmental cataclysms. The Extended Edition and Retold versions add new quality-of-life features, better compatibility, and improved Steam Workshop support (for the Extended Edition ; the Retold version uses an in-game mod browser), so sharing custom campaigns is easy.

The editor has a playful, experimental vibe. It's the perfect choice for would-be demigods who want to create their own legends, or just see what happens when an army of villagers has access to every god power at once!

Wargroove 2

A Very Accessible Map Builder

Released
October 5, 2023
Platform(s)
PC, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, Xbox Series X
Powered by

While the turn-based tactics of Wargroove 2 are approachable, players owe it to themselves to check out the campaign and map editor. Players can build custom skirmish maps and entire branching campaigns, complete with dialogue, cutscenes, and complex victory conditions. There's so much freedom that some users have managed to make Wargroove 2 into a puzzle game, a stealth adventure, or a light RPG - right inside the scenario editor!

The interface is designed for accessibility, letting first-timers complete a viable map in minutes, but the depth is there for those who want to create a saga worthy of Nintendos classics. Best of all, there's a library of user-made content and a friendly Discord to help troubleshoot one's most convoluted storylines.

Combat Mission Series

Plenty Of Campaign Tools For History Buffs

Combat Mission: Beyond Overlord
Released
June 14, 2000

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Battlefront's Combat Mission series is not for the faint of heart. The built-in scenario editor is granular: players can tweak every parameter, from terrain elevation to weather to the morale of individual squads. Custom scenarios can be strung together with persistent forces and branching outcomes, making it perfect for constructing multi-stage operations.

The payoff is in the level of control players get over every aspect of the battlefield. Theres a small, dedicated community producing a steady stream of high-quality user campaigns, each pushing the limits of the games engine and AI. If youre someone who thinks in fields of fire and logistics, Combat Mission is worth a look.

Men Of War: Assault Squad 2

Leverage The GEM Editor For Cinematic Battles

Men of War: Assault Squad 2
Real-Time Strategy
War & Military
Systems
Released
May 15, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Men of War: Assault Squad 2 is known for its brutal, almost sandbox-like WW2 combat, and also implements one of the most flexible scenario editors in any strategy game. The GEM Editor lets players create custom skirmishes, cutscenes, scripted events, and set pieces. The editors learning curve is as steep as the cliffs at Pointe du Hoc, but the sheer power it gives is worth the initial struggle.

For the detail-obsessed, players can hand-place each sandbag and fence post for maximum immersion. The Men of War community is very prolific, churning out everything from historically accurate tank battles to what if scenarios starring aliens and zombies.

Heroes Of Might & Magic 3

The Adventures Never Have To Stop With This Editor

Heroes of Might and Magic 3
9.6 /10
Released
March 3, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone // Violence
Powered by

This map editor is a classic, offering a deceptively simple interface that hides its fair share of complexity. Fans can design sprawling adventure maps, set custom victory and loss conditions, and write elaborate quest chains and story events. Some community-made campaigns are straight-up remakes of the original games best moments. Others are full-blown RPGs or puzzles that twist the rules in unexpected ways.

With the HoMM3 HD mod and the Horn of the Abyss community expansion, the scenario editor is even more powerful. The player who wants to dream up a tale of betrayal worthy of song, loot, and dragons, or just design a tiny island where everyone starts with a thousand Titans, Heroes of Might & Magic 3 makes it possible.

Age Of Empires 2: Definitive Edition

The Modernized Classic

Age of Empires 2: Definitive Edition
9.0 /10
Released
November 14, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

The king of historical RTS has only gotten better with age, and so has its scenario editor. The Definitive Edition preserves the originals much-loved map-making tools and also supercharges them with modern features, better scripting, and quality-of-life improvements that make custom campaign design a lot of fun. However, the secret sauce lies in the event triggers and AI scripting, which allow for story-driven scenarios and head-scratching challenges.

Theres an active community producing everything from historical epics to meme campaigns about ducks and trebuchets. Plus, the Mod Manager integration means players can share their creations or download others maps for inspiration in the blink of an eye.
